intro: Cyclobalanopsis acuta var. yanagidae, commonly known as the Japanese ironwood, is a rare and hardy evergreen tree native to southern Japan. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its dense, durable wood. The tree typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in cool, moist climates with well-drained soil. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and elliptical in shape, while its acorns are small and have a distinctive cap. Due to its rarity and ecological importance, it is often found in specialized conservation areas.
